thread.title: Europe’s Upstart ETF Market Makes Some Strides

author: Tanzeel Akhtar
title: Europe’s Upstart ETF Market Makes Some Strides
text:
The European appetite for exchange-traded funds, though well behind that of investors in the U.S., continues to grow. New products and the entry of new categories of investors have been a boost, experts say.
While the European market is still dominated by a few big firms, Deborah Fuhr, managing partner at ETFGI, a research and consultancy firm based in London, says there are now 64 issuers of ETFs in Europe. Recent entrants include JPMorgan Chase and Index IQ from the U.S., andVanEck Associates has just bought Dutch ETF issuer... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
